data.title: Disability/Neurodivergence
data.meta_description: Because disabled, chronically ill, and/or neurodivergent queer rep is so rare, I've included "Additional books of note," which are books by disabled and/or neurodivergent queer authors which feature both major queer/trans characters and disabled and/or neurodivergent characters, although queerness and disability/neurodivergence do not intersect in a single character. Addiction Stars in Your Eyes by Kacen…
data.text:
Because disabled, chronically ill, and/or neurodivergent queer rep is so rare, I’ve included “Additional books of note,” which are books by disabled and/or neurodivergent queer authors which feature both major queer/trans characters and disabled and/or neurodivergent characters, although queerness and disability/neurodivergence do not intersect in a single character.

Addiction

Stars in Your Eyes by Kacen Callender

Constellations by Kate Glasheen (YA GN)

Thirsty by Jas Hammonds (YA)

False Start by Santana Knox

Pomegranate by Helen Elaine Lee

A Shot in the Dark by Victoria Lee

Just By Looking at Him by Ryan O’Connell

Clean by Amy Reed (YA)

Bath Haus by P.J. Vernon

The Stagsblood Prince by Gideon E. Wood

ADHD
